paragraphs.text: Can you stop using these three labels in 2015: 'Poor people,' 'date rape' and 'victim'.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Can you banish the labels "date rape," "victims" and "poor people" from your vocabulary in 2015?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Labels can diminish and demean or to uplift and affirm people
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: 2015 will be a year of hope and dignity by redefining or banishing these toxic and harmful labels
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In their place a more generous, positive and compassionate country will emerge
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Here's
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: why
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: a deeper look at these three labels
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Date Rape
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: This is the most commonly talked about fear on college campuses across the country
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: 2014 was filled with stories of sexual abuse from the ranks of the NFL and their spouses to the iconic Bill Cosby
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: On college campuses date rape involves issues of consent and sobriety; of women who feel that they don't have the ability to consent or not; of alcohol and drugs like "roofies" used as excuses and no specific profile of the typical rapist
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The words date and rape should never be accepted as co-joined words
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: My friend Tony Porter of A Call to Men says that gender based violence will only end when men address it and reassess what it means to be a man
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He is correct
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: To be on a date is to enter into an exploration of romance, companionship and possibly love
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is about exploring the possibilities of human togetherness and relationship
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Rape is a criminal and violent exercise of abuse and power
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: To disassociate these two words - rape and date - is to redefine the expectation of healthy and also criminal behavior
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You can redefine the term date rape by celebrating the possibilities of healthy dating and mincing no words about the criminality of rape
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Engaging young men in the cause of stopping gender based violence will bring with it lasting impact on healthy relationships
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Victims
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: The accusers of sexual violence are commonly called victims
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: They are typically the victims of aggressive non-consensual sex
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: to call them victims is to deny their courage and strength
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The supermodel Janice Dickinson recently said that she is not an accuser
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: She explained this by saying that she is speaking her truth about what Bill Cosby did to her decades ago
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: How strong do you have to be to speak out against those who are iconic figures or heroes- whether clergy, Cosby or NFL players?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: To speak your truth against power typically results from years if not decades of inner work along with courage that reveals you have come to love yourself enough to not be intimidated by the powerful iconic figures who have committed sexual abuse
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: People like Dickinson are empowered, courageous victims
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They give hope to others including the many men who feel that their manhood will be compromised if they speak out against their male sexual abusers
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Empowered victims like Dickinson move us quickly from just feeling sorry to feeling admiration for their courageous empowerment
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What happened to them is criminal and to label them as just victims demeans their courage
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Empowered victims elevate their status and shine a bright spotlight on their heinous sexual aggressor
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Poor People
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: A pervasive new classism in the United States has emerged according to columnist David Brooks of the New York Times
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: He posits that the meritocratic class view themselves as the respectable ones who have the ability to choose their own destiny
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: They view the poor as lazy, disorganized, violent and scary
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: In this view the poor are not proper human beings
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's a dangerous construct that dehumanizes vast segments of our community
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I've spent a lifetime working with and knowing people who are poor
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Most work hard and often at several jobs
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: like other human beings they yearn for the best for their children and families and have aspirations to live beyond poverty
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: the organization of the lives of those who are poor is different from that of the meritocratic class
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it is because of genetic roulette and the systems that often work to trap people in the mire of less opportunity
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Brooks suggests that those who label the poor in this way live in a world that keeps them from knowing poor people
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: The label begins to be redefined when you take time to know those who are different from you
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is up to you to make change in the New Year by not accepting these labels and then redefining them
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You will be part of creating a more compassionate, generous and positive landscape
paragraphs.label: assumption
